core_concepts.question: Create a namespace called 'mynamespace' and a pod with image nginx called nginx on this namespace
author: SOMETHING
core_concepts.answer:
```bash
kubectl create namespace mynamespace
kubectl run nginx --image=nginx --restart=Never -n mynamespace
```

core_concepts.question: Create the pod that was just described using YAML
author: SOMETHING
OTHER THING
core_concepts.answer:
```bash
# Easily generate YAML with:
kubectl run nginx --image=nginx --restart=Never --dry-run -o yaml > pod.yaml
```

```bash
# View the Pod 
cat pod.yaml
```

```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  creationTimestamp: null
  labels:
    run: nginx
  name: nginx
spec:
  containers:
  - image: nginx
    imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
    name: nginx
    resources: {}
  dnsPolicy: ClusterFirst
  restartPolicy: Never
status: {}
```

```bash
# Create the pod from file with namespace overwrite
kubectl create -f pod.yaml -n mynamespace
```

```bash
# Alternatively, you can run in one line
kubectl run nginx --image=nginx --restart=Never --dry-run -o yaml | kubectl create -n mynamespace -f -
```
